text: Choi Chang-ik (hangul:최창익, hanja:崔昌益, 1896-1957), also known as Choe Chang Ik, was a North Korean soldier and politician.Nate.com, 최창익(崔昌益) retrieved 2012-7-25. ==Career== In the early North Korean government, Choi was Deputy Prime Minister from 1952 to 1956. In a 1956-1957 purge, he was removed from government by forces led by Kim Il-sung.Kraus, Charles. "Between Yan’an and Pyongyang: The Case of Choe Chang-Ik," SinoNK.com. April 12, 2012; retrieved 2012-7-25. He was expelled from the Korean Workers' Party.Nam, Seungji. Independent Diplomacy Between North Korea and China Following the 20th Communist Congress of the Soviet Union, pp. 16-17 [PDF 19-20]; retrieved 2012-7-25. == Related pages == * Kim Du-bong * Kim Won-bong ==References== ==Other websites == * 최창익 [崔昌益, 1896~1956 at Naver Encyclopedia] Category:1896 births Category:1957 deaths Category:North Korean politicians
title: Choi Chang-ik
